security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document from the Assassination Records Review Board concerns the postponed release of certain information within HSCA staff payroll records (Record Number 180-10060-10447), specifically Social Security numbers, due to privacy concerns.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 8, 1995, the Assassination Records Review Board issued a Final Determination Notification regarding HSCA staff payroll records. The board postponed the release of Social Security numbers within the document due to concerns about unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, determining that such an invasion outweighs the public interest. The Board cited the significant historical interest in the document and the absence of evidence that the release of other information would cause harm to the United States or any individual, and scheduled the next review for 2017.
title: Final Determination Notification Regarding HSCA Staff Payroll Records
